item.title: Kaseya hack - how it all began (amateur research)
item.description: This research was completed by July 16, 2021 I became a finalist with the report about the “Kaseya hack” at “The Young Hats” competition from “The Standoff”. My report is available here (ru) Intro to post One winter in 2021, I met some cool guys from the Indian company Bluefire Redteam and wrote osint tasks for their CTF. In the spring of the same year, the guys invited me to their new two-month course (internship) on Advanced osint.

item.title: Just introðŸ’¥
item.description: About me (cybersecurity) student of the National Research University MPEI (information security) web malware analyst at Kaspersky Lab (2 years) CTF player (member of the “Unicorn team”) winner and prize-winner in various competitions related to cybersecurity participant and speaker of educational events at “Sirius” University, Positive Technologies, Bank of Russia cyber threat analyst osint enthusiast About me (other passions) professional photography amateur passion for astronomy and other things related to space sometimes traveling (publishing on my Instagram) My posts will be about… I will write exclusively about topics related to cybersecurity (osint, web threats, networks, auditing, cyber news, phishing): I will show my researches, interesting finds on the web, useful tools, explore different malware samples, CTF tasks (which I solved and which I wrote myself), the competitions in which I participate.
